meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being subservient.
meanings.sent1: Her subservience to her boss was evident in how she always followed his orders without question.
meanings.sent2: The dog showed subservience to its owner by wagging its tail and obeying commands.
meanings.sent3: The robot's subservience to its programmer was so complete that it even made the programmer's coffee in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The tree's subservience to the wind was evident in its branches swaying in unison with the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The knight's subservience to the king was unwavering, as he carried out every command with loyalty and dedication.

meanings.definition: The state of being submissive or obedient.
meanings.sent1: His subservience to authority figures often led him to comply with their requests without question.
meanings.sent2: In the wild, animals show subservience to the alpha of the pack through body language and deference.
meanings.sent3: The cat's subservience to its owner was evident when it brought a mouse as a gift to show loyalty.
meanings.sent4: The waves' subservience to the moon's gravitational pull creates the ebb and flow of the tides.
meanings.sent5: The student's subservience to the teacher was clear as she diligently completed all assignments on time.

meanings.definition: Acting in a subordinate or servile manner.
meanings.sent1: The subservience attitude of the butler was evident in his polite and deferential behavior.
meanings.sent2: She found his subservience behavior towards her to be off-putting and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The robot's subservience programming made it always defer to human commands, even in silly situations.
meanings.sent4: The subservience role of the sidekick in the movie added comic relief to the serious plot.
meanings.sent5: The subservience nature of the employee was evident in how he always sought approval before making any decisions.
